examples: No one, least of all those with a musical ear, can take a form or even read a book in close proximity to the ineffectual tootle of a flute, the maddening squeaks of a raw fiddler, or the spasmodic grunts of a euphonium.
In between, is Granny May’s only daughter Juliet. A wonderful character who still joins me on the odd tootle.

verbs.description: tootle (third-person singular simple present tootles, present participle tootling, simple past and past participle tootled)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To make a soft toot sound.
examples: Now the scythe the morn salutes,

entries.meaning: (transitive) To play (a musical instrument) making such a sound.
examples: A young, fresh-faced man, sitting by the driver, tootled a tandem horn.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, colloquial) To go (somewhere); to amble aimlessly.
examples: I suppose we’d better tootle back to the ballroom.
[…]  he would just see if his shover had enough in the tank to tootle them down to Warborough  […]
